intro: Barclaya panchorensis, commonly known as the Panchore barclaya, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Barclaya panchorensis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
